author: Jim Chairusmi
description: The 13-1 long shot was one of five fresh horses in the Preakness that didn’t run two weeks ago in the Kentucky Derby.
title: Cloud Computing Pulls Surprise Win in Preakness Stakes

description: Cloud Computing started as a 13-1 longshot but came from behind to win the 142nd Preakness Stakes in Baltimore, ending Kentucky Derby winner Always Dreaming's quest for the Triple Crown.
title: Cloud Computing takes Preakness Stakes in upset

author: Ben FawkesESPN Staff Writer
description: Kentucky Derby winner Always Dreaming remains the favorite after Wednesday's Preakness Stakes draw. A look at where each of the field's 10 horses will start on Saturday from Pimlico.
title: 2017 Preakness odds

author: BETH HARRIS
description: BALTIMORE (AP) — Sometimes it pays to have a fresh horse. Cloud Computing skipped the Kentucky Derby, while eventual winner Always Dreaming and Classic Empire mixed it up in the mud at Churchill Downs. Two weeks later, Cloud Computing pounced on those two horses in the Preakness, pulling off an upset victory at 13-1 odds Saturday. He became the first horse to skip the Derby and win the second leg of the Triple Crown since filly Rachel Alexandra in 2009. "Some of the reason that we won today was because we were patient and didn't throw an inexperienced horse against a 20-horse field in the Derby on a very difficult track," winning co-owner Seth Klarman said. "We made a great call."
title: Rested and ready: 13-1 shot Cloud Computing wins Preakness

author: DAVID GINSBURG
description: BALTIMORE (AP) — Charging hard down the stretch, Lookin At Lee barely missed winning the Kentucky Derby as a 33-1 long shot. His second-place finish seemingly impressed no one. Lookin at Lee has received little attention at Pimlico Race Course this week and is a 10-1 underdog in the Preakness behind Always Dreaming, the 4-5 favorite in Saturday's race after outlasting Lookin At Lee by a mere 2 3/4 lengths at Churchill Downs. What gives? "We don't worry about that too much," Lookin at Lee assistant trainer Scott Blasi said after Wednesday's draw. "He's a blue-collar horse and probably easy to overlook, but he's not for us."
title: Lookin At Lee eyes Preakness glory after strong run in Derby
